result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E Brzezinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IF Revoked: Sentence credit of 3 days is granted. 
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 1 year.
Consecutive to: -To 22CF986.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. 
-Inform doctor and any pharmacy of convictions. 
-No use/possession of any CBD products. 
-No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

-No dangerous weapons. 
-If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
dated 10-21-2022 from the DOC, requesting review of count 1 of the Judgment of Conviction.  
**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 10-24-2022:  JOC to be corrected.  
**sent to case manager for drafting of corrected/amended JOC on 10-24-2022 (mjs)

Case called at 2:08 p.m.
Attorney Christian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Michael E Brzezinski.  
Defendant Michael E Brzezinski in court, in custody.  
Defendant's parents appeared in court.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
State strikes the repeater enhancer on Count 1.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Counts 2, 3, and 4 are dismissed and read-in.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  36 MONTHS
Initial Confinement:  12 MONTHS
Extended Supervision:  24 MONTHS
3-Days Credit, if Revoked
Sentence to run Consecutive to 22CF0986  

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program after 1-year.
SENTENCE IS STAYED (added on 9-20-22)

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Inform doctor and any pharmacy of convictions
No use/possession of CBD products
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchases used, stored, packaged, or distributed
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered;  filed by Atty. Justin Griffis
